Yi,

In order to build Cantera, you need Visual C++ or some other C++  
compiler on Windows. But if you only want to *use* Cantera in Matlab or  
Python, then you don't need to build it - just download and install the  
binary Windows distribution.

Dave


On Friday, May 2, 2003, at 07:47 PM, yijiangusa wrote:

> David,
> A quick question for you:
> Do I have to have both Visual C++ and Compaq Fortran installed in
> order to run cantera v1.4 windows version?
> Since I have only Compaq Fortran 6.1 installed in my PC, after
> followed "Window Build procedure" using Compad Visual 6.1
> regarding "examples", the "build" process gave folowing error message:
> ......
> ......
> P:\MY DOCUMENTS\Cantera-1.4\ext\blas\daxpy.f
> P:\MY DOCUMENTS\Cantera-1.4\ext\blas\dasum.f
> Creating library...
> --------------------Configuration: cantera - Win32 Release------------
> --------
> Compiling...
> Error spawning cl.exe
>
> examples.exe - 1 error(s), 0 warning(s)
>
>
> Yi
